body:
What was the date of last functioning version ?
Do you have any error messages in console? In JS console ?

You could try to force-refresh the browser that might cache some Javascript also, or try "Private browsing" mode of your browser that do not share cache with other sessions.

last functionning version over which I installed the 2.0.0dev was  a 1.0.0.
I upgraded another similar installation to 1.1 and all is ok for this one.

full messages on the dos window are

Can you open the developer console in the browser and see if there are error message in it ?

ha, it works if I set the requested (??) notebook-dir to the mandatory (??) value
%WINPYDIR%\python.exe  %WINPYDIR%\Scripts\%variable_launch%  --notebook-dir=C:\Users\famille\Documents\winpython\WinPython-32bit-3.3.2.3ggplotip2\python-3.3.2

but I don't see any "now you can change  your notebook directory" button... is there a missing part in my update Process ?
Drag and Drop works, except it pills up notebooks in the unwhished "python-3.3.2" directory.
Audio cells of "Part 5 - Rich Display System.ipynb" works.
developer console ?
There's no UI for the multidirectory stuff yet, but you can access notebooks in subdirectories of the notebook directory where you started the server, if you put the relative path in the URL.
ok, but why does it now complains, if i whish to start in a specific "my_choice" directory for notebooks ? It was ok in 1.1
I'm not sure. If you run it with `--debug`, do you see any error messages or anything in the terminal?

> You could try to force-refresh the browser that might cache some Javascript also

I second this suggestion, did you try dumping your Javascript cache?  I had the same problem and I just needed to dump my cache.

Ah, thanks @jdfreder,
Switching to Chrome, everything is back to 1.1 normality
My initial attempt of  "Private browsing" on firefox was not working, probably because of a bad manipulation.
firefox really needs a clear of its "Public browsing" cache.

So we cannot play with both 2.0 dev and 1.1 (under firefox) ?

I don't think private browsing will work for this - private browsing won't put anything into the cache, but presumably it can still read from the regular cache. If you're switching between different IPython versions, then yes, you do need to keep clearing browser caches. Ctrl-F5 (force refresh) often works, but there are cases where even that doesn't.
With Firefox, you can also have multiple profiles, which should have independent caches - start it with the arguments `-P "My Profile" -no-remote`.

On chrome private browsing does not read cache.

You can also have 1.1 and 2.0 on different ports.

Envoyé de mon iPhone

> Le 30 oct. 2013 à 18:14, stonebig notifications@github.com a écrit :
> 
> Closed #4462.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

ah, ok.  I'm not use to the "Profile" notion of Firefox.
Thank you for your time, and congratulations for the "single codebase" switch.

Ah, going further, I have another issue.
I'm now trying to launch "spyder" in my brand new ipython2.0, and I have this error

```
  File "C:\Users\famille\Documents\winpython\WinPython-32bit-3.3.2.3ggplotip2\python-3.3.2\lib\site-packages\ipython-2.0.0_dev-py3.3.egg\IPython\core\prompts.py
", line 241, in <module>'cwd': LazyEvaluate(os.getcwdu),
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'getcwdu'
```

Apparently, os.getcwdu doesn't exist in python3.
==> Is it a miss of ipython "single codebase" ?
If I do  replace (with notepad++) all ".getcwdu" per ".getcwd", spyder works, and opens a ipython qtconsole 2.0.0-dev.

Yes, that sounds like I missed something. Though I'm puzzled as to why I
don't see that failure on my machine.

On 31 October 2013 10:14, stonebig notifications@github.com wrote:

> Ah, going further, I have another issue.
> I'm now trying to launch "spyder" in my brand new ipython2.0, and I have
> this error

> ", line 241, in <module>'cwd': LazyEvaluate(os.getcwdu),
> AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'getcwdu'
> 
> Apparently, os.getcwdu doesn't exist in python3.
> ==> is it a miss of ipython "single codebase" ?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/4462#issuecomment-27505816
> .
it didn't show up on ipython notebook
If you start a plain Python terminal, does `import os; os.getcwdu` exist? It does on my Linux system.
no, wait...we must be setting it somewhere, it's only there in IPython.
This windows PC is intentionnaly "python-less" at the system level, so only the winpython directory I select, pure python3, is on my path. and os.getcwdu has apparently been removed in python3.
The path.py module we bundle is setting `os.getcwdu = os.getcwd`. That must not be getting loaded on your machine, or being loaded after the prompts module. I'll look into it.
Can you try PR #4469? That should fix that error.
